pullRequest.body:
This PR add changes `pullback.fst`, `pullback.fst`, `pushout.inr` and `pushout.inl` to have explicit parameters.

---
<!-- The text above the `---` will become the commit message when your
PR is merged. Please leave a blank newline before the `---`, otherwise
GitHub will format the text above it as a title.

For details on the "pull request lifecycle" in mathlib, please see:
https://leanprover-community.github.io/contribute/index.html

In particular, note that most reviewers will only notice your PR
if it passes the continuous integration checks, and is labeled with `awaiting-review`.
Please ask for help on https://leanprover.zulipchat.com if needed.

To indicate co-authors, include lines at the bottom of the commit message
(that is, before the `---`) using the following format:

Co-authored-by: Author Name <author@email.com>

Any other comments you want to keep out of the PR commit should go
below the `---`, and placed outside this HTML comment, or else they
will be invisible to reviewers.

If this PR depends on other PRs, please list them below this comment,
using the following format:
- [ ] depends on: #abc [optional extra text]
- [ ] depends on: #xyz [optional extra text]
-->

- [x] depends on: #14524

[![Open in Gitpod](https://gitpod.io/button/open-in-gitpod.svg)](https://gitpod.io/from-referrer/)

nodes.body:
### PR summary [f8a7e22a85](https://github.com/leanprover-community/mathlib4/pull/14526/commits/f8a7e22a8599aeeb451eb034bdc16635cf58bb07)

#### Import changes for modified files

No significant changes to the import graph


<details><summary>Import changes for all files</summary>

|Files|Import difference|
|-|-|

</details>

---

<details><summary>

#### Declarations diff

</summary>

`+ instance (f : X ‚ü∂ Z) (g : Y ‚ü∂ Z) [QuasiCompact f] : QuasiCompact (pullback.snd f g)`
`+ instance (f : X ‚ü∂ Z) (g : Y ‚ü∂ Z) [QuasiCompact g] : QuasiCompact (pullback.fst f g)`
`+ instance : IsSplitEpi (pullback.fst f f)`
`+ instance : IsSplitEpi (pullback.snd f f)`
`- instance (f : X ‚ü∂ Z) (g : Y ‚ü∂ Z) [QuasiCompact f] :`
`- instance (f : X ‚ü∂ Z) (g : Y ‚ü∂ Z) [QuasiCompact g] :`
`- instance : IsSplitEpi (pullback.fst : pullback f f ‚ü∂ X)`
`- instance : IsSplitEpi (pullback.snd : pullback f f ‚ü∂ X)`
<details>
  <summary>You can run this locally as follows</summary>


```bash
## summary with just the declaration names:
./scripts/no_lost_declarations.sh short <optional_commit>

## more verbose report:
./scripts/no_lost_declarations.sh <optional_commit>
```
</details>

</details>

This PR/issue depends on:
* ~~leanprover-community/mathlib4#14524~~
By **[Dependent Issues](https://github.com/z0al/dependent-issues)** (ü§ñ). Happy coding!
<!-- By Dependent Issues (Action) - DO NOT REMOVE -->

In general, compared to other mathlib users, I am not a huge fan of implicit parameters, but even I got used to using implicit parameters in this case. Then, I am not sure we want to proceed in this direction.

> In general, compared to other mathlib users, I am not a huge fan of implicit parameters, but even I got used to using implicit parameters in this case. Then, I am not sure we want to proceed in this direction.

It seems many people are for making these arguments explicit, see this [zulip thread](https://leanprover.zulipchat.com/#narrow/stream/287929-mathlib4/topic/Implicit.20parameters.20in.20.60pullback.2Efst.60.20and.20.60pullback.2Esnd.60)

In many places the implicit parameters makes reading harder (when you have multiple pullbacks) and also sometimes the code becomes longer as people have to write `pullback.fst : pullback f g \hom _` instead of just `pullback.fst f g`.

Ok. Thanks!

bors merge
:-1: Rejected by label

Please merge it when it passes CI:

bors d+

:v: callesonne can now approve this pull request. To approve and merge a pull request, simply reply with `bors r+`. More detailed instructions are available [here](https://bors.tech/documentation/getting-started/#reviewing-pull-requests).
bors r+

Pull request successfully merged into master.

Build succeeded:
  * [Build](https://github.com/leanprover-community/mathlib4/actions/runs/9894197834/job/27331131837)
  * [Lint style](https://github.com/leanprover-community/mathlib4/actions/runs/9894197834/job/27331132818)

pullRequest.title: [Merged by Bors] - feat(Limits/Shapes/Pullback): Give pullback.fst and friends explicit parameters

source.title: [Merged by Bors] - feat(Limits/Shapes/Pullback): add more pasting lemmas

nodes.body:
This PR/issue depends on:
* ~~leanprover-community/mathlib4#14524~~
By **[Dependent Issues](https://github.com/z0al/dependent-issues)** (ü§ñ). Happy coding!
<!-- By Dependent Issues (Action) - DO NOT REMOVE -->

In general, compared to other mathlib users, I am not a huge fan of implicit parameters, but even I got used to using implicit parameters in this case. Then, I am not sure we want to proceed in this direction.

> In general, compared to other mathlib users, I am not a huge fan of implicit parameters, but even I got used to using implicit parameters in this case. Then, I am not sure we want to proceed in this direction.

It seems many people are for making these arguments explicit, see this [zulip thread](https://leanprover.zulipchat.com/#narrow/stream/287929-mathlib4/topic/Implicit.20parameters.20in.20.60pullback.2Efst.60.20and.20.60pullback.2Esnd.60)

In many places the implicit parameters makes reading harder (when you have multiple pullbacks) and also sometimes the code becomes longer as people have to write `pullback.fst : pullback f g \hom _` instead of just `pullback.fst f g`.

Ok. Thanks!

bors merge
